law.catch_line: Auditory screening of infants at hospitals and birthing centers -- Forwarding of reports.

text.section: As a condition of licensure or relicensure, all hospitals offering obstetric services and alternative birthing centers with at least forty (40) births per year shall provide an auditory screening for all infants using one (1) of the methods approved by the Commission for Children with Special Health Care Needs by administrative regulation promulgated in accordance with KRS Chapter 13A.

An auditory screening report that does not indicate a potential hearing loss shall be forwarded within one (1) week to the Commission for Children with Special Health Care Needs with no information that personally identifies the child.

law.history: Amended 2009 Ky. Acts ch. 102, sec. 3, effective June 25, 2009. -- Created 2000 Ky. Acts ch. 308, sec. 11, effective July 14, 2000.
